    • Uses of ExtensionRequestParameter in com.tinkerpop.rexster.kibbles.sample

      Method parameters in com.tinkerpop.rexster.kibbles.sample with annotations of type ExtensionRequestParameter 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExtensionResponse PingExtension.evaluatePing(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, String reply)
      Exposes the ping extension from the root of the graph name accepting a single parameter called "reply" which will be echoed back in the a JSON response.
      ExtensionResponse PingAddOnExtension.evaluatePing(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, String reply) 
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeFloat(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, Float reply)
      http://localhost/graphs/tinkergraph/tp-sample/parameters/float?some-float=test
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeInteger(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, Integer reply)
      http://localhost/graphs/tinkergraph/tp-sample/parameters/integer?some-integer=1
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeList(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONArray reply)
      Lists are parsed to JSONArray from the URI when passed as

      http://localhost/graphs/tinkergraph/tp-sample/parameters/list?some-list=[1,2,3]
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeListRaw(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, String reply)
      To pass a string value that contains square brackets set parseToJson = false

      http://localhost/graphs/tinkergraph/tp-sample/parameters/list-raw?some-list=[1,2,3]

      In this case, the data type is not a JSONArray but a String.
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeObject(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, Integer reply, org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONObject replyObject, org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONArray replyList)
      Accessing:

      http://localhost:8182/graphs/tinkergraph/tp-sample/parameters/object?a=1&b.a=marko&b.b=true&b.c.a=peter&c=[marko,povel]

      would yield three parameters that could be injected to this method: an integer for "a", a JSONObject for "b" and a JSONArray for "c".
      ExtensionResponse ParametersExtension.evaluateSomeObject(RexsterResourceContext context, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Graph graph, Integer reply, org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONObject replyObject, org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONArray replyList)
